subject: HISTORY
text: Give an account of three of the following, showing their importance in the reign of William the Conqueror:— the Battle of Hastings; the Oath of Salisbury; the Royal Forests; Domesday Book; Archbishop Lanfranc.

subject: HISTORY
text: Why did David I support the Church in Scotland and what developments did he encourage in it ?

subject: HISTORY
question: 2. b
text: Describe daily life in a twelfth-century monastery. (References to any monastery you know will be welcome.)

subject: HISTORY
text: State briefly why there were disorders in Stephen’s reign. What reforms were carried out in military affairs and in justice by Henry II to prevent further disorders ?

subject: HISTORY
text: Which do you think was the most successful of the Crusades and why ? What were the main results of the Crusades for Europe ?

subject: HISTORY
text: Give an account of King John’s dealings with the King of France and with the Church.

subject: HISTORY
text: What problems faced Bruce after the murder of Comyn (1306) ? Give an account of his career from then up to the Treaty of Northampton (1326).

subject: HISTORY
text: Give an account of Edward Ill’s dealings with Scotland. Why did he go to war with France ?

subject: HISTORY
text: “ The Black Death was the most important event of the later Middle Ages.” Do you agree ?

subject: HISTORY
text: Give an account of conditions in Scotland when James I returned from England (1424). What did James do to restore order ?

subject: HISTORY
text: Write notes on two of the following:— Malcolm Canmore; Norman church architecture; the cultivation of the demesne on a manor; St. Francis of Assisi; Roger Bacon; the trivium and quadrivium; the Battle of Largs; Edward I and parliament; fairs and markets.

subject: HISTORY
text: In what ways do the reigns of James IV and James V mark the end of the Middle Ages in Scotland ?

subject: HISTORY
text: Give a brief account of each of the following items and explain its importance:— Cardinal Beaton; The Lords of the Congregation; The Reformation Parliament (1560).

subject: HISTORY
text: Write notes on two of the following:— the marriages of Mary Queen of Scots; James VI and the Scottish Kirk; industry and trade in the reign of James VI; the Union of the Crowns.

subject: HISTORY
text: Describe the part played by Scotland in the Civil Wars between Charles I and the English parliament, taking account of: the Solemn League and Covenant, the Marquis of Montrose, and the Engagement.

subject: HISTORY
text: Outline the terms of the Restoration Settlement in Scotland in church and state. To whom and for what reasons did it give cause for discontent ?

subject: HISTORY
text: Explain how the Union of 1707 came about. What in your opinion was the most important factor making for union ?

subject: HISTORY
text: State briefly where the Jacobite movement got most of its support and for what reasons. Describe the measures taken to pacify the Highlands after the Forty-five.

subject: HISTORY
text: Describe the changes which took place in the life and work of people in the lowlands in town or country in the eighteenth century.

subject: HISTORY
text: Outline the main developments in internal transport in Scotland since (1750).

subject: HISTORY
text: Describe the work of Scottish missionaries and soldiers in India in the nineteenth century. What contribution was made to the westernisation of India by the Earl of Dalhousie ? Has there been a distinctively Scottish contribution to Indian affairs ? Give reasons for your answer.

subject: HISTORY
text: Write notes on two of the following:— The Porteous Riots; Thomas Muir; the Municipal Reform Act, 1833; The growth of shipbuilding or coalmining in Scotland; Church union in Scotland and the movement for Christian Unity.

subject: HISTORY
text: Either Say what you understand by the terms “ Home Rule ” and “ Devolution ”. What attempts have been made since the appointment of a Scottish Secretary in 1885 to provide Scotland with some control of its own affairs ? What measures of this kind operate today ?

subject: HISTORY
question: 22. b
text: Give an account of two of the following with special reference to Scottish history:— The growth of the Labour movement; the Great Depression of the nineteen- thirties; declining industries and new industries since 1945; the Toothill report.

subject: HISTORY
text: Describe the achievement of three of the following, explaining their historical importance:— Vasco da Gama; Cortes; Leonardo da Vinci; Michael Angelo; John Calvin; Ignatius Loyola; Copernicus; Galileo.

subject: HISTORY
text: In what ways did either James IV or Henry VII benefit his country ?

subject: HISTORY
text: Describe, under the following headings, the changes made by Henry VIII in religious affairs:— the power of the Pope; the monasteries; changes in worship and doctrine.

subject: HISTORY
question: 25. b
text: Or Sketch the career of John Knox showing the changes in Scottish religion that he helped to bring about.

subject: HISTORY
text: Describe the contributions made to Elizabethan maritime achievements by two of the following:— Hawkins; Drake; Raleigh.

subject: HISTORY
text: What were the main terms of the Statute of Artificers (1563), and the Elizabethan Poor Law (1601) ? Discuss the economic problems that one of these was intended to solve.

subject: HISTORY
text: Give an account of James Fs dealings with the English Parliament. What light do these throw on his character ?

subject: HISTORY
text: What problems faced Charles I during the eleven years of personal rule (1629-40) and how did he meet them ? Explain the breakdown of his personal rule.

subject: HISTORY
text: Outline briefly the course of the First Civil War (1641-46). How do you account for the Royalist defeat ?

subject: HISTORY
text: Describe am countries:— Ireland; Scotland; Spain.

subject: HISTORY
text: Write notes on two of the following, showing their importance:— Catherine of Aragon; The Protector Northumberland; Edmund Campion; Andrew Melville; Francis Bacon; The Pilgrim Fathers; The Barebones Parliament.

subject: HISTORY
text: What were the main provisions of the Clarendon Code and the Test Act and what was their importance ?

subject: HISTORY
question: 33. b
text: Or describe Charles IVs religious policy in Scotland and explain the opposition which it encountered.

subject: HISTORY
text: In what circumstances did two of the following take place and what was their importance ? The Bill of Rights; the Act of Settlement; the abolition of the Lords of the Articles; the Treaty of Limerick.

subject: HISTORY
text: Either Discuss the contribution of Marlborough to the defeat of Louis XIV in the War of the Spanish Succession.

subject: HISTORY
question: 35. b
text: Or describe what were the main terms of the Treaty of Utrecht ? Was that treaty fair to Britain’s allies ?

subject: HISTORY
text: Give an account of two of the following:— The Royal Society; Highland life on the eve of the Forty-five; the life of an eighteenth-century Lowland laird; the life of an eighteenth-century English squire; Edinburgh society in the late eighteenth century.

subject: HISTORY
text: Explain how Walpole contrived to keep the support of the monarch, and parliament, in the period (1721-1742). How do you account for his fall in 1742 ?

subject: HISTORY
text: Describe the military achievement of Clive in India and Wolfe in Canada.

subject: HISTORY
text: Explain briefly what is meant by the following:— the old colonial system, and “no taxation without representation ”.

subject: HISTORY
question: 39b
text: Give an account of the events in George Ill’s reign leading up to the revolt of the American colonies.

subject: HISTORY
text: What is meant by the Enclosure Movement in England, and what was its importance in the Agrarian Revolution ? Explain briefly the different situation in Scotland as regards enclosure.

subject: HISTORY
text: What were the main changes in inland transport in the Industrial Revolution period before the coming of railways ?

subject: HISTORY
text: Write notes on two of the following:— the Popish Plot; the “Young Pretender”; the Duke of Newcastle; the Carron Ironworks; Adam Smith’s “ Wealth of Nations ”; “ Wilkes and Liberty ”.

subject: HISTORY
text: Give an account of two of the following aspects of the work of the younger Pitt:— his commercial and financial policy in time of peace; either the India Act (1784) or the Canada Act (1791); his policy of repression after the outbreak of the French war; his conduct of the wars against France.

subject: HISTORY
text: Give an account of two of the following:— the slave trade and its abolition; child labour and its regulation up to the Factory Act of 1833; the contribution of Francis Place or Robert Owen to the Trade Union movement; the main terms and consequences of the Poor Law Amendment Act (1834).

subject: HISTORY
text: Either describe briefly the struggle to pass the Reform Bill in the years 1831-

subject: HISTORY
text: What were the main changes in the Electoral system of either Scotland or England brought about by the Reform Act of 1832 ?

subject: HISTORY
question: 32b
text: Or describe what were the demands of the Chartists and which of them had been, met by 1914 ? Why did so many people oppose their proposals at the time ?

subject: HISTORY
text: Explain the part played by engineers and railway companies in making Britain’s railways in the nineteenth century. What advantages did the railways have over other forms of transport in the mid-nineteenth century ?

subject: HISTORY
text: Describe the part played by Disraeli in two of the following:— the second Reform Act; the purchase of the Suez Canal shares; the Congress of Berlin; his relations with Queen Victoria. What light do the topics of your choice throw on the character and views of Disraeli ?

subject: HISTORY
text: What were the main reforms of Gladstone’s first ministry, 1868-74 ? Which do you think was the most important and why ?

subject: HISTORY
text: Explain the importance to Ireland and to Britain of three of the following:— the Act of Union (1801); Daniel O’Connell; the potato famine; the Land League; the first Home Rule Bill.

subject: HISTORY
text: Explain, and show the importance of, three of the following:— {a) the Bank Charter Act, 1844; (6) the growth of limited liability companies;

subject: HISTORY
question: 50c
text: the growth of co-operative societies; {d) the decline in agriculture, 1870-1900;

subject: HISTORY
question: 50e
text: the Dock Strike (1889). Page seven Marks

subject: HISTORY
text: Either describe the extension of British power in India from Wellesley to Dalhousie. (A sketch map would help.) (6) Or what were the causes of the Indian Mutiny ? How do you account for the failure of the Mutiny ?

subject: HISTORY
text: Write short notes on two of the following:— the Athenian Age in Edinburgh; the Naval Mutinies of 1797; the Berlin Decree (1806); Peterloo; Mehemet Ali; David Livingstone; Florence Nightingale; “ the Crofters War ”; Lord Lister.

subject: HISTORY
text: Marconi; Watson-Watt; Rutherford; Edison; Baird; Fleming; the Wright Brothers. Give a brief account of three of these and show the importance of the achievements with which they are associated.

subject: HISTORY
text: Outline the course of events that led to the passing of the Parliament Act of (1911). What changes did it effect in parliament ? State briefly any important change that has been made since in the Act.

subject: HISTORY
text: Describe the achievements of the Labour Government of 1945-51 in:— National Insurance;  National Health Insurance, and The nationalisation of industries.

subject: HISTORY
text: Give an account of two of the following:— Joseph Chamberlain and Tariff Reform; King Edward VII; the Sinn Fein movement 1916-21; the Representation of the People Act (1918); Ramsay MacDonald; the General Strike of 1926; the Scottish Home Rule Movement in the twentieth century.

subject: HISTORY
text: Either sketch the career of Gandhi, showing his importance in Indian history.

subject: HISTORY
question: 57.  b
text: Or trace the course of events in the twentieth century leading to the independence of India in 1947, showing why partition came about.

subject: HISTORY
text: Either describe and account for two of the following aspects of the peace settlement of 1919:— the treatment of Germany; the treatment of Austria; the setting up of the League of Nations.

subject: HISTORY
question: 58.  b
text: Or " When President Wilson returned to America in 1919, with the Treaties he had signed and the Covenant of the League he had created, the Senate repudiated both.” Answer the following questions: Who was “ President Wilson ” ? What is meant by “ the League ” ? In what circumstances, and with what aims, had it been established ? What is “ the Senate ” and how is it chosen ? Why would a British parliament be unlikely to treat a British Prime Minister as Wilson was treated by the Senate ?

subject: HISTORY
text: Give an account of Hitler’s foreign policy from 1933 to (1939).

subject: HISTORY
text: Write notes on two of the following:—• the Gallipoli Campaign; Fascist rule in Italy; Thomas Masaryk; the Spanish Civil War; fighting in North Africa in the Second World War; Hiroshima.

subject: HISTORY
text: Either give an account of three of the following and show their importance in Russian history:— Kerensky; the New Economic Policy; Trotsky; the collectivisation of agriculture; Hitler’s Russian Campaign.

subject: HISTORY
question: 61. b
text: Or sketch the career of Franklin D. Roosevelt up to Pearl Harbour. (You may find the following headings useful: personal background; the Great Depression; the New Deal; the end of Isolationism.)
